meanings.definition: footsloggers (noun): soldiers who march on foot
meanings.sent1: The footsloggers marched through the muddy field.
meanings.sent2: The footsloggers were exhausted after a long day of marching.
meanings.sent3: The footsloggers joked about their sore feet at the end of the day.
meanings.sent4: The footsloggers' determination was as solid as their boots.
meanings.sent5: The image of the footsloggers trudging along stayed with me.

meanings.definition: footsloggers (verb): to march on foot in a slow and laborious manner
meanings.sent1: We had to footsloggers through the thick forest to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers footsloggers for hours under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The hikers footsloggers up the steep hill, panting and sweating.
meanings.sent4: The protesters footsloggers through the city streets, chanting slogans.
meanings.sent5: The workers footsloggers through the snowstorm to get to the factory.
